summary: The bill, titled the "Coordination for Soil Carbon Research and Monitoring Act," aims to establish an interagency committee to coordinate and advance research, development, and monitoring of soil carbon sequestration. The Interagency Committee, led by the Office of Science and Technology Policy, will comprise representatives from various federal agencies and will focus on developing a strategic plan, proposing roles for each agency, submitting reports to Congress, and encouraging collaboration with stakeholders including experts from academia, private industry, and nonprofit organizations. The bill also authorizes $10,000,000 in appropriations for its implementation.
